ingredients: 250 g closed cup or chestnut mushrooms
2 x 400 g tins of chopped tomatoes , or 2 x 500g cartons of passata
1 small butternut squash , peeled and seeds removed, grated
½ a bunch of fresh thyme
1 x 450 g jar of roasted red peppers
1 handful of freshly grated pecorino cheese
2 large fresh green chillies , ideally Serrano
½ a bunch of fresh coriander
2 rashers of higher-welfare smoked streaky bacon
1 wineglass red or white wine, or cider , or a good splash of port or sherry
½ clove garlic , peeled and bashed to a pulp
1 good handful fresh basil , bashed to a pulp
1 small handful toasted pine nuts , bashed to bits
1.5 kg beetroots , different colours and sizes
85 ml British beer , such as Fuller's London Pride
a small bunch of green and purple basil or coriander
2 tablespoons white wine or cider vinegar
10 sprigs fresh thyme or lemon thyme , leaves picked
2 kg raw higher-welfare chicken carcasses , legs or wings chopped
½ head garlic , unpeeled and bashed
½ a bunch of fresh soft herbs , such as chives, mint, basil or fennel tops
1 cinnamon stick , or 1 pinch of ground cinnamon
1 x 250 g jar of quality cranberry sauce
4 x 200 g quality sirloin or rib-eye steaks , ideally 2.5cm thick
100 g shelled roasted monkey nuts (skins removed)
a few sprigs of fresh thyme
8 tablespoons best-quality extra virgin olive oil
½ shallot , or ½ a small white onion, finely chopped
2 tablespoons white or red wine vinegar
2 tablespoons white or red wine vinegar
75 g dried cranberries , really finely chopped
4 sprigs of fresh rosemary , leaves picked
70 g onion , peeled and finely chopped
300 ml organic chicken or vegetable stock
2 medium red onions , peeled and chopped
1 sprig fresh rosemary , leaves picked and chopped
150 ml Champagne vinegar , (you can also use cider vinegar)
flatbreads, pitta bread or chunky bread
1 small handful dried apricots , torn or roughly chopped
1 large red onion , peeled and roughly chopped
½ bulb fennel , trimmed and roughly chopped
1 stick celery , trimmed and roughly chopped
1 thumb-sized piece fresh ginger , peeled and roughly chopped
½ fresh red chilli , deseeded and finely chopped
1 bunch fresh basil , leaves picked, stalks chopped
1 kg yellow, orange or green tomatoes , chopped, or 500g cherry or plum tomatoes, halved plus 500g tinned plum tomatoes
1 tablespoon black or white sesame seeds, toasted
1 small piece of cinnamon , or cassia
400 g firm white fish fillets , such as pollock, skin off, from sustainable sources
a few sprigs of fresh flat-leaf parsley
500 g cranberries , fresh cranberries or frozen ones, thawed
2 bramley apples , peeled, cored and cut into chunks
½ a bunch of fresh coriander
10 sprigs of fresh thyme or lemon thyme , leaves picked
a small bunch of fresh tarragon , leaves picked
8 firm pears , peeled, cored and quartered
4 cloves garlic , peeled and finely sliced
1 bunch fresh basil , leaves picked and torn
3 x 400 g good-quality tinned plum tomatoes
2 big handfuls of fresh flat-leaf parsley
1 small handful of gherkins, in sweet vinegar
8 tablespoons really good extra virgin olive oil
a few springs of fresh coriander
a large bunch of fresh basil , leaves picked
1 cooked jersey royal or new potato
1 x 400 g tin of plum tomatoes
1 good handful of freshly grated Parmesan cheese
1 kg ripe strawberries , washed and leafy tops removed
1 x veg trivet , (see Jamie’s easy turkey recipe)
1 splash of red wine, vin santo, sherry or port , optional
Pan juice from the turkey , approximately 100ml
100 - 300 ml fresh stock , (which you can make yourself or buy from most supermarkets)
1 large bunch mixed soft fresh herbs, such as flat-leaf parsley, basil and mint
2 kg beef bones , with bone marrow
2 kg whole dry-aged sirloin of beef
1 small bunch fresh mint , leaves picked and finely chopped
